revised_title: Astronomical Observations on the Rotation of Planets and the Equability of Earth's Diurnal Motion
tldr: In this article, William Herschel discusses the challenges of measuring the diurnal rotation of planets and the equability of Earth's motion using time-keepers. He proposes a method to estimate the diurnal motion of one planet by comparing it to another, using Mars as an example due to its visible spots and stable rotation.
